intro: Conyza modesta, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender stems covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple composite flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Conyza modesta is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields, where it thrives in full sun.
